conclusion: Trace the path of the liquid from each source (A, B, and C) through the baffles to the bottom containers.
Liquid from A will initially flow downward and encounter the first yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle is slanted towards the left, directing the liquid to the left.
The liquid will then hit the brown baffle, which is slanted towards the right.
The brown baffle will direct the liquid to the right, towards the opening above container D.
Liquid from B will flow downward and encounter the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle is slanted towards the left, directing the liquid to the left.
The liquid will then hit the red baffle, which is slanted towards the right.
The red baffle will direct the liquid to the right, towards the opening above container D.
Liquid from C will flow downward and encounter the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle is slanted towards the left, directing the liquid to the left.
The liquid will then hit the gray baffle, which is slanted towards the right.
The gray baffle will direct the liquid to the right, towards the opening above container E.
Liquid from A and B will flow into container D; Liquid from C will flow into container E.
